newsitem.title: GERMANY: Singapore airport buys Frankfurt baggage system.
newsitem.headline: Singapore airport buys Frankfurt baggage system.

text.p: Flughafen Frankfurt Main AG (FAG) said subsidiary FAG Aircraft Handling had won its first Asian contract for its FRA-BRS computerised baggage reconciliation system.

Singapore Airlines and its subsidiary Singapore Air Terminal Services have decided on the Frankfurt baggage management system for Changi Airport following an international tender, a FAG statement said.
FAG spokesman Robert Payne said Singapore is the fourth international airport after the UK's Heathrow, Gatwick and Manchester airports to use the Frankfurt system.
He could not say what the value of the contract was or when the system would be installed in Singapore.

FRA-BRS, in operation at Frankfurt Airport since 1993, prevents an aircraft departing with checked-in baggage if the passenger is not on board. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44-171-542-7706 Fax+44-171-542-5017
